programme.desc: To Catch a Thief: Part 1: Discover what the Golds really think about one of the most infamous episodes ever. When jewellery is found scattered, Les knows something is afoot. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Top Ten Alien Craft: Count down the top ten alien craft, from V-shaped objects to orbs of light to flying saucers. (S15, ep 14)

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Edgar Cayce - The Sleeping Prophet: In the 1900s, a modern-day prophet Edgar Cayce became a worldwide sensation. He claimed to receive visions of both the past and future. (S15, ep 16)

programme.desc: Acid Test: While Seth mulls over an expensive purchase that could save the store thousands, a customer attempts to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. (S3, ep 3)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Gold War: While Seth struggles through a tense customer interaction, Les has his hands full with a tough negotiation over a vintage gumball machine. (S3, ep 4)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Lemming Interference: Grizzy has prepared himself a TV dinner, but his meal is interrupted by unexplained static. Grizzy finds that the true 'interference' is down to the lemmings. (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: High Voltage Bear Attack: The lemmings are having a party, but when Grizzy throws their ghetto blaster into the river he sparks a power cut! (S1 Ep18)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Scents: Grizzy decides to give she-bear the flowers that decorate the window ledges of the ranger's cabin. Can he bring them to her without the lemmings ruining them? (S1 Ep19)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Bear Luck: After making a fool of himself in front of she-bear, Grizzy finds a four-leaf clover which seems to bring him good luck. Could his chance be changing? (S1 Ep20)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings
programme.desc: Magnetic Bear: Grizzy can't believe his eyes when he sees objects moving all by themselves, but it's the lemmings who are playing around. (S1 Ep21)

programme.desc: Bear Charm: Grizzy believes that the she-bear he's in love with has been turned into a frog. He looks through the ranger's book of fairytales, searching for a way to turn her back. (S1 Ep22)

programme.title: Grizzy And The Lemmings

programme.desc: A Fish Called Leshawna: After eating some mystery fish sticks, Leshawna achieves every little girl's dream and transforms into a mermaid! (S2 Ep45)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Double Oh Beth: With most of the class already gone for spring break, a villain infiltrates the school. Luckily a sleeper agent has been lying in wait. Hold on... it's Beth?!? Oh boy... (S2 Ep46)

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Duncan Duty: When Duncan realises Chef is getting kids to tattle on him in return for chocolate milk, he sees an opportunity. (S2 Ep47)

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Shock & Aww: When Courtney gets the old, gross daycare carpet replaced with a new one, the resulting static electricity has unexpected consequences. (S2 Ep51)

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Total Dramarama

programme.title: Lost Lagoon
programme.desc: 1958. Drama. Directed by John Rawlins. Stars Jeffrey Lynn, Leila Barry & Peter Donat. An unhappy husband dreaming of escape becomes a castaway on an island after his boat runs into a storm. [S]

programme.title: The Shakedown
programme.desc: 1960. Drama. Terence Morgan plays 'Augie' a crook just released from prison and intent on getting his rackets back from 'Collar' (Harry H Corbett). Stars Bill Owen, Robert Beatty and Hazel Court. [S]

programme.title: Mutiny
programme.desc: 1952. Starring Mark Stevens & Angela Lansbury. During the war of 1812, the U.S. arranges to borrow gold from France. A young Captain must navigate through the British blockade. [S]

programme.title: London Entertains
programme.desc: 1951. Musical Comedy. Director E J Fancey. Starring Eamonn Andrews and the Goons. A Tour conducted by Eamonn Andrews around the Battersea Festival to a BBC Studio to hear The Goons of radio fame. [S]

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The Case of the Blind Man's Bluff. 1954. Starring: Ronald Howard, Howard Marion-Crawford & Archie Duncan. The only clue is a chicken's foot. Insp. Lestrade goes to Sherlock Holmes for assistance. [S]

programme.title: Kiss the Bride Goodbye
programme.desc: 1944. Joan's (Patricia Medina) mother wants her to marry her pompous boss although she loves a soldier (Jimmy Hanley). One of Jean Simmon's first films. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Once Upon a Time
programme.desc: 1967. A wonderful trip to Denmark to look at the Danish way of life.

programme.title: The Flaw
programme.desc: 1955. Crime directed by Terence Fisher. A racing driver (John Bentley) plans to murder his heiress wife (Rona Anderson). The lawyer (Donald Houston) discovers the plot. [S]

programme.title: Serena
programme.desc: 1962. Drama. Directed by Peter Maxwell. Stars Patrick Holt, Emrys Jones & Honor Blackman. An inspector strives to solve the mystery of an artist's dead wife. The artist becomes the main suspect. [S]

programme.title: Four Star Playhouse: The Bomb
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Directed by Blake Edwards. Stars David Niven, Margaret Sheridan & John Dehner. Three people become trapped in an abandoned farmhouse and discover a live bomb in the basement. [S]

programme.title: The Night We Dropped a Clanger
programme.desc: 1959. A Wing Commander (Brian Rix) is on a mission to find out about the flying bomb. Stars William Hartnell, Leslie Phillips, Leo Franklyn & Liz Fraser. [S]

programme.title: The Captain's Paradise
programme.desc: 1953. Comedy. Directed by Anthony Kimmins. Stars Alec Guinness, Yvonne De Carlo, Celia Johnson & Miles Malleson. The Captain of a ferry boat between Gibraltar & Morocco has a woman in each port. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: Conduct Prejudicial - Part 1. 1973. Stars William Mervyn, Terrence Hardiman, Stephen Yardley & Robin Bailey. Squadron leader Pardoe, a serving RAF officer, is charged with espionage. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: Conduct Prejudicial - Part 2. 1973. Stars Stephen Yardley, Ruth Trouncer & David Hargreaves. Pardoe is confirmed to have been pictured with a spy and later makes an interesting admission. [S]

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: Conduct Prejudicial - Part 3. 1973. Stars Ewan Roberts, Stephen Yardley, Delena Kidd. The designer of the guidance system on the Banshee missile takes to the stand. Will his testimony help Pardoe? [S]

programme.title: Witness In The Dark
programme.desc: 1959. Drama. A burglar murders an old woman but a blind girl 'witnesses' the robber as he flees. Stars Patricia Dainton, Conrad Phillips, Nigel Green & Richard O'Sullivan. [S]

programme.title: The Crowded Day
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Director: John Guillermin. Stars Joan Rice, Josephine Griffin, Freda Jackson. The story of the ups and downs of a group of salesgirls at a department store in the run up to Christmas. [S]

programme.title: The Cheaters
programme.desc: For the Price of Two. 1961. Stars John Ireland & Rosemary Dorken. When Laura Desmond's twin sister is found dead and a heavy payout is due, Hunter suspects things are not as they seem. [S]

programme.title: The Brothers
programme.desc: Tender. 1976. Stars Jean Anderson, Colin Baker & Kate O'Mara. News that RAI Transport is going into liquidation smothers the Hammond grapevine. Jenny decides it is her chance to prove her form. [S]

programme.title: Travelling Man
programme.desc: Moving On. 1984. Stars Leigh Lawson, Colin Jeavons & Jeffrey Hardy. While Lomax works in a riverside pub, he is spotted by a man from his past who plots to drive him away from the area. [S]

programme.title: The Gold Robbers
programme.desc: Account Rendered. 1969. Stars Peter Vaughan, Bernard Hepton & Daphne Slater. A brilliant accountant and paymaster to the gold robbers becomes desperate when violence enters his safe, family life. [S]

programme.title: The Glass
programme.desc: Episode 6. 2001. Stars John Thaw, Joe McFadden, Sarah Lancashire, Paul Jesson & Emily Joyce. The lives of Paul, Jim and Carol unravel, as devastating revelations come to the surface. [S]

programme.title: Black Tuesday
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Directed by Hugo Fregonese. Stars Edward G. Robinson, Jean Parker & Peter Graves. A death row inmate breaks free on the eve of his execution, but will the law catch up with him?

programme.title: Black Tuesday
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Directed by Hugo Fregonese. Stars Edward G. Robinson, Jean Parker & Peter Graves. A death row inmate breaks free on the eve of his execution, but will the law catch up with him?

programme.title: Too Young To Love
programme.desc: 1959. Directed by Muriel Box. Stars Jess Conrad, Pauline Hahn, Joan Miller & Austin Willis. Based on the play, Pickup Girl by Elsa Shelley. A story of a young girl's lapse into sex delinquency. [S]

programme.title: Road to Bali
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy. Directed by Hal Walker. Stars Bing Crosby, Bob Hope & Dorothy Lamour. Two vaudeville performers accept diving work in Bali and find treasure, love and trouble along the way. [S]

programme.title: Four Star Playhouse: Trail's End
programme.desc: 1953. Drama. Directed by Robert Florey. Stars Dick Powell, Lee Van Cleef & Richard Hale. A famous marshal of Dodge City sets out in search of the murderous Sonoma Kid and stumbles upon a tragedy. [S]

programme.title: Melody Club
programme.desc: 1949. Comedy. A nitwit investigator (Terry Thomas) goes undercover in a restaurant to catch a gang of crooks. [S]

programme.title: Sounds for Silents
programme.desc: A captivating reel about how music was created for silent films.

programme.title: Snowball
programme.desc: 1960. Crime. Directed by Pat Jackson. Stars Gordon Jackson, Kenneth Griffith, Zena Walker and Dennis Waterman. After forgetting his ticket, a devious young boy causes trouble for the conductor. [S]

programme.title: The Night We Dropped a Clanger
programme.desc: 1959. A Wing Commander (Brian Rix) is on a mission to find out about the flying bomb. Stars William Hartnell, Leslie Phillips, Leo Franklyn & Liz Fraser. [S]

programme.title: Shepherd On The Rock
programme.desc: 1993. Drama. Directed by Bob Keen. Starring Bernard Hill, John Bowles and Betsy Brantley. A sheep farmer and his family fight for their land against the persistent efforts of a land developer. [S]

programme.title: The Great Milk Bottle Mystery
programme.desc: 1950s short film made by the British Milk association on the loss of 6.4 million milk bottles a week. It's time to do your bit before the coal runs out. Can you help Mrs Jones of 22 Acacia Grove?

programme.title: Murder In Reverse
programme.desc: 1945. Crime. Director: Montgomery Tully. Stars William Hartnell, Jimmy Hanley & Chili Bouchier. After a long imprisonment, a man wrongfully framed for murder hunts for the truth and the killer. [S]

programme.title: The Writing on the Wall
programme.desc: Mike Read travels across Britain to find the intriguing Blue Plaques around the country, and the stories behind them. This episode features the Titanic, Windrush, Buddy Holly and Elvis Presley. [S]

programme.title: Nowhere To Go
programme.desc: 1958. Crime. Directors: Seth Holt, Basil Dearden. Stars George Nader, Maggie Smith, Bernard Lee. Paul Gregory is released from jail, following a stretch for robbing a woman who falls for his charms.

programme.title: Four Star Playhouse: Tusitala
programme.desc: 1955. Drama. Directed by Roy Kellino. Stars David Niven, Gertrude Michael & John Lupton. Nearing the end of his life, Robert Louis Stevenson mediates between two Samoan tribes to prevent war. [S]

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: 1952. Comedy. Stars Duncan Macrae, Joseph Tomelty, Charles Hawtrey, Ronnie Corbett, Patrick Barr. A new Lord Rector arrives at Skerryvore University that turns out to be an attractive young woman. [S]

programme.title: Scotland Yard
programme.desc: 1962. The Square Mile Murder. Directed by Allan Davis. Starring John Welsh, Delphi Lawrence and Stanley Morgan. When a travel agency is burgled Supt. Hicks is brought in to solve the case. (S1, E39)

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: The Jim Twins/Flitwick Ghost. 1995. Michael Aspel examines two unusual cases, including a look at the fascinating story of the Jim Twins and a look at the ghost who haunts Flitwick Manor. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Join Caroline Munro for a strange and mysterious night. First up, is another superb episode of Doomwatch called Flight into Yesterday, about the odd aftereffects of long haul flights. [S]

programme.title: Doomwatch
programme.desc: Flight into Yesterday. 1971. Stars John Paul & Desmond Llewelyn. After a long-haul flight Dr Quist's reputation is put in doubt when he arrives drunk to a meeting with the Prime Minister. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: A groundskeeper causes all sorts of trouble in a remote country estate in The Nightcomers. Caroline Munro introduces the 1971 British horror starring Marlon Brando and Stephanie Beacham. [S]

programme.title: The Nightcomers
programme.desc: 1971. Horror. Directed by Michael Winner. Stars Stephanie Beacham, Marlon Brando & Thora Hird. A groundskeeper of a country estate corrupts a virtuous governess and the children she looks after. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Next week, there will be more investigations and a cold, evil presence - keep watching to find out why, as Caroline Munro introduces the upcoming features. [S]

programme.title: They Live
programme.desc: 1988. Sci-fi Horror. Directed by John Carpenter. Stars Roddy Piper, Keith David & Meg Foster. A homeless drifter discovers a pair of sunglasses capable of showing the world the way it truly is. [S]

programme.desc: King Badtz Rules: Badtz-Maru discovers an ancient Penguinese crown with the power to control his friends. Explorer Kitty must find a way to get the crown back to the Penguinese temple! (S1 Ep22)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: DB's Big Show: DB has a show coming up, he's afraid people won't want to see him do the same old thing. Pop Star Kitty helps DB realize the key to a great performance is doing what you love. (S1 Ep23)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Tiny Frido, Big World: Feeling overlooked by Zonty, Frido decides to run away, but she accidentally miniaturises herself and ends up getting lost. (S1 Ep24)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Key to a Legend: PI finds a mysterious key in the museum. Detective Kitty helps him search for the door it opens, while Frido plots to steal the key, and the treasure it might bring. (S1 Ep25)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Goodbye Kitty: Keroppi invites Kitty to join him on a trip around the world. But her friends panic about her leaving and use up Kitty's precious time to pack. (S1 Ep26)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Miguel VS Thunderfoot: When Thunderfoot keeps knocking down a bridge, Miguel realizes that the big spinosaur has a hidden reason for wanting the bridge out of the way. (S2 Ep21)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Light Touch Tango: When Tango's usual smash-and-bash approach makes things worse for the day's chores, with help from Miguel's singing she learns how to gently save the day! (S2 Ep22)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Perky Finds His Purpose: When Perky stows away on a mission to find missing Parasaurs, he complicates things when he tries to help the ranchers herd them home, but proves himself in the end. (S2 Ep23)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Raptor Showdown: Blitz and a pesky microraptor are pitted against one another in a cat and mouse battle of wills, but the tiny dino is a much bigger problem than expected. (S2 Ep24)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Blown Away: Masha finds someone's umbrella in the forest and decides to urgently return it. After a fun search, the owner of the umbrella is found, but why is he so dissatisfied? (S6 Ep12)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Who's Gifted?: Christmas is a time of miracles and gifts. All inhabitants prepared performances for Santa Claus, but Masha was the best prepared. Does the wizard have enough gifts for her? (S6 Ep13)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Smells Fishy: Robbery of the century! The ever-hungry Wolves managed to unhook a huge tank for transporting live fish from the train. But there was a strange passenger among the fish. (S6 Ep14)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: That's the Thing!: Bear's closet is full of strange and wildly interesting things. Masha and Panda find a very interesting thing there, which becomes a real puzzle for them! (S6 Ep15)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Fluffy Dessert: The clouds are so airy, so similar to different sweets and, are probably, very tasty! Masha and the Bear decide to take to the skies and try the airy dessert. (S6 Ep16)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Collection Passion: Rosie has a herbarium. Bear has a collection of rare stamps. And what does Masha have? Masha also wants to collect something, but she just can't figure out what exactly. (S6 Ep17)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Be in the Pink!: Oh no! The baby is sick! Rosie the Pig has developed an incomprehensible rash after falling into a nettle bush. (S6 Ep18)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: A Pineapple of Discord: The Wolves find someone's pineapple in the forest. The temptation to eat it is stronger than the desire to find the real owner, until Masha appears at their table. (S6 Ep19)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Where Did it Goat?: The Bear and the other forest inhabitants are puzzled: huge circles have appeared in the field near the forest. Moreover, Masha's Goat has disappeared! (S6 Ep20)

programme.title: Bubble's Hotel
programme.desc: Bubble's Magic: When Bubble accidentally causes the hotel to ice over during the Midwinter Festibubble, she goes on a quest to the volcano's magic spring to find a magic solution. (S1 Ep41)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Blue Pinky: When Kitty discovers Pinky is having a blue day, she goes on a mission to cheer her up. (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Green With Envy: When Zing gets carried away by her competitive spirit, she grows a giant flower that threatens Cherry Town - and Kitty's friends! Can Construction Kitty save the day? (S1 Ep18)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: The Charmed Bracelet: Pinky puts an ancient Penguinese bracelet on Rio, not knowing it has an ancient curse! Now Rio copies everything Pinky says and does. (S1 Ep19)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: Too Many Fridos: Frido has to work at the fair but all she wants to do is have fun on the rides! Using Zonty's gizmo, she makes a clone to work the fair for her. (S1 Ep20)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: The Bowterfly Effect: When Pinky captures the Queen Bowterfly to bring home, the rest of the bowterflies follow and create havoc. Can Explorer Kitty guide them all back to the forest? (S1 Ep21)

programme.title: Hello Kitty: Super Style!
programme.desc: King Badtz Rules: Badtz-Maru discovers an ancient Penguinese crown with the power to control his friends. Explorer Kitty must find a way to get the crown back to the Penguinese temple! (S1 Ep22)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Unbearable Beach: On a nice summer's day Bear, as usual, goes fishing. But the fishing trip didn't quite work out: the forest dwellers made a "beach" at Bear's favourite spot. (S5 Ep26)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: When a Pig Flies: Rosie has lost her peace because of the ripe, appetising acorns growing right above her little snout. (S6 Ep1)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: All You Need is a Goal: The ball is on the field, the players are in the field, the Bear in the chair is rooting for his favourite team. But Masha got bored in anticipation of a goal. (S6 Ep2)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Soup Pursuit: The wolves are going to cook borscht under Masha's guidance. They have a cookbook, a big pot and a ravenous appetite. But they still gotta get the ingredients! (S6 Ep3)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Tricky Tricks: Bear's old circus friend Tiger comes to visit. What could be more wonderful than to passionately play chess with your best friend? But Masha has her own idea of miracles. (S6 Ep4)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Think Outside the Box: Masha and Penguin go to Mars and from there they go straight to the open sea to the Frog Princess, and new adventures are already waiting for friends overboard. (S6 Ep5)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Coach Cory: Cory coaches Chrissy and her friends in a high stakes bumperball game against her rival Bobby Mini Van's team, coached by Bobby's older brother, Buddy Mini Van. (S1 Ep57)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Itchy Sweater: Cory gets a special sweater from his Nana Carson as a gift. But can he make it through the weekend without her realizing how itchy it is? (S1 Ep58)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Freddie the Houseguest: When Freddie stays over at the Carson's for a whole week, Cory finds that spending that long together is harder than he bargained for. (S1 Ep59)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Cory and the Tuba: Cory gets a tuba and his family suffers the consequences. (S1 Ep60)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: School Play: Cory is sure he's going to get the starring role of the school play, but when he loses out on the part, he needs to learn about what it means to fill a supporting role. (S1 Ep61)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Garage Sale: The Carsons have a competitive garage sale; whoever sells the most gets to decide where the family goes for vacation. (S1 Ep62)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Catboy's Magic Trick: Determined to perform a magic trick, Connor finds an ancient teleporting sarcophagus. (S5 Ep17)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko The Croc: Gekko is forced to be a sneaky crocodile instead of a loyal lizard because Pharaoh Boy has taken his friends prisoner. (S5 Ep18)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The Camping Trip: Greg feels scared on an overnight camping trip. He thinks his night-time powers will help him but Orticia has something worrying in store. (S5 Ep19)

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Pondweed Party: Orticia gets invited to Octobella's cave to help grow powerful pondweed. (S5 Ep20)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: No Birthday without Hazelnuts: Today is Jean-Claude's birthday! To celebrate, Billy and Suzie have decided to make a fantastic hazelnut birthday cake with him. JC is thrilled!(S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: Rodeo Stars: Discovering that Jessy Dog takes part in rodeos, Billy decides he wants to do the same. But how will he manage without a horse? Scott's rocking chair will do just fine! (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: Cactus Herbal Tea: Jean-Claude has caught a cold. Billy thinks he should protect his throat with a neckerchief, so he takes JC to see Dede Rabbit to ask if he can borrow his scarf. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: The New Sheriff: Billy finds a gift in the latest issue of The Adventures of Jessy Dog - a sheriff's badge! He fastens it to his chest and sets off in search of some bad guys to arrest. (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: The Great Dino Escape: When Sonny the Kid rustles Blitz, Tango, and Clover, both the Ranchers and the dinos must have the confidence to work separately in order to be reunited. (S1 Ep49)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Shake Rattle and Roar: The Dino Ranchers are having a party for all their dinos and friends, and are shocked to realize the invitations for Clara, Ike, and Ogie Tinhorn were never sent! (S1 Ep50)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Tall in the Saddle Drive: When a Brontosaur Leader gets separated from her herd, Dino Ranchers need to keep the herd from scattering until she can reunite with them and lead the migration. (S1 Ep51)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Min-Perfection: Min's drive to impress Ma gets the best of her when she tries to help Quack get over a scare without making a single mistake. (S1 Ep52)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Wranglin' Thunderfoot: When Jon wrongly accuses Thunderfoot of scaring their dino herds, he creates trouble for Thunderfoot and for himself. (S2 Ep1)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Jane's Perfect Present: After the Jr Ranchers spend all their time trying to prepare a special surprise birthday gift for Jane, they find out what she wanted was to spend the day with them. (S1 Ep5)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Pterodactyl-Doodle-Doo: Miguel and the Jr Ranchers learn that taking other people's feelings into consideration is the most important part of any good deed. (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: Dino Ranch
programme.desc: Tango Dino-Sits: When Tango is asked to babysit the dino mites, she underestimates how big the job will be. (S2 Ep5)

programme.desc: Fast Friends: Blitz's patience is tested when he and Jon try to train a fast young raptor. (S2 Ep6)
